intro: Bonania cubana subsp. acunae, commonly known as Cuban bonania, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Cuba. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain several seeds. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
